qas.question: Which region is Oklahoma City a part of?
What offices employ US transportation and Air force bases?

answers.text: Tinker Air Force Base and the United States Department of Transportation's Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center

context: Oklahoma City, lying in the <a0_0>Great Plains region<a0_0/>, features one of the largest livestock markets in the world. Oil, natural gas, petroleum products and related industries are the largest sector of the local economy. The city is situated in the middle of an active oil field and oil derricks dot the capitol grounds. The federal government employs large numbers of workers at <a1_0>Tinker Air Force Base and the United States Department of Transportation's Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center<a1_0/> (these two sites house several offices of the Federal Aviation Administration and the Transportation Department's Enterprise Service Center, respectively).
